alert.note: Alert for Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:09PM CDT until July 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN OSAGE...WESTERN COFFEY AND EASTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 908 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Hartford, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 853 PM CDT, a spotter near Reading reported quarter sized hail. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Burlington, Lebo, New Strawn, Hartford, Neosho Rapids, Reading, Olivet, John Redmond Reservoir, Melvern Lake and Le Roy. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 133 and 154. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 140 and 148. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
